responses.text: Could you tell me about the community?
What do you see in your visions?

dynamic_line: Hi, <name_g>.  Could I pat you on the shoulder?  I wanna be sure you're here.

responses.text: Nice talking to you, but I gotta go.

dynamic_line: Yeah, just that I sometimes see things.  I wanna be sure you're real.

responses.text: It's alright, just take your time.

dynamic_line: I've had a bad run of things.  I grew up real poor, in a bad part of town, always got my nose where it shouldn't have been.  When I was about eighteen, I started doing coke heavily.  Every two days, I'd get spaced out on the stuff; started robbing gas stations and dumb <swear> things like that for a fix.  I went to jail, and I met the New England Church Community there.  I joined up to find penance for my sins.  Another thing, stay off of that <swear> stuff; I messed up my brain real bad doin' that.

They're not so hot.  The whole compound is always low on food, there's <swear> <zombies> out on the roads, and Helena's starting to panic a bit.  She thinks I'm a holy visionary, with my episodes…  Sometimes I want to believe her.  I usually take the Thorazine Jane has, but I've been getting it less and less.
Well, its an old church group that decided to become doomsday preppers.  I don't know much else, except that they used to do a lot of charity work.  I met them that way.
Nah.  Not everything's perfect around here, but it's the only thing I've got left.

&Arturo stares blankly for a moment.  "The man in the mirror comes to me at night, and whispers things in my ear.  Eyes on the walls, watching, watching…  The woman who crawls."  I'm sorry about that.
